meanings.def: containing, or tasting as if it contains, a lot of sugar
examples: a cup of hot sweet tea
sweet food
I had a craving for something sweet.
roast duck with a sweet and sour sauce
sweet sherry
This wine is too sweet for me.
I found the dessert a bit sweet for my taste.
She booked a hotel suite overlooking Central Park.
Add some honey to make it sweet.
Suck this sweet—it might soothe your throat.

meanings.def: having a pleasant smell
examples: a sweet-smelling rose
The air was sweet with incense.
The air smelled sweet and clean.
an overpowering, sickly sweet smell

meanings.def: having a pleasant sound
examples: a sweet voice

meanings.def: pleasant and not containing any harmful substances
examples: the sweet air of a mountain village

meanings.def: making you feel happy and/or satisfied
examples: Goodnight. Sweet dreams.
I can't tell you how sweet this victory is.
He played a sweet shot onto the final green (= in golf).
an act of sweet revenge

meanings.def: attractive
examples: His sister's a sweet young thing.
You look sweet in this photograph.
We stayed in a sweet little hotel on the seafront.
a rather sweet little cottage
What a sweet little dog!

meanings.def: having or showing a kind character
examples: She gave him her sweetest smile.
He's one of the sweetest people I know.
it is sweet of somebody to do something It was sweet of them to offer to help.
He’s not what you’d call sweet-tempered!
a sickeningly sweet smile
She was really sweet to me.
She looked so sweet and innocent.

meanings.def: used to show that you approve of something
examples: Free tickets? Sweet!

meanings.def: to like somebody very much in a romantic way
to like food that contains a lot of sugar
used to say how pleasant your home is (especially when you really mean that it is not pleasant at all)
how and when you want to, even though this might annoy other people
examples: He always does the work, but in his own sweet time.
She just ignores all the criticism and continues on her own sweet way.

meanings.def: to say or do pleasant things in order to keep somebody in a good mood so that they will agree to do something for you
examples: You’d better keep her sweet if you want her to lend you the money.

meanings.def: what is important is what people or things are, not what they are called
everything is all right
pleasant but not lasting a long time
examples: We haven't much time so I'll keep it short and sweet.

meanings.def: nothing at all. People say ‘sweet FA’ to avoid saying ‘fuck all’.
romantic words
examples: to whisper sweet nothings in somebody’s ear

meanings.def: the pleasant feeling of being successful

idioms.def: to like somebody very much in a romantic way
to like food that contains a lot of sugar
used to say how pleasant your home is (especially when you really mean that it is not pleasant at all)
how and when you want to, even though this might annoy other people
examples: He always does the work, but in his own sweet time.
She just ignores all the criticism and continues on her own sweet way.

idioms.def: to say or do pleasant things in order to keep somebody in a good mood so that they will agree to do something for you
examples: You’d better keep her sweet if you want her to lend you the money.

idioms.idiom: a rose by any other name would smell as sweet
idioms.def: what is important is what people or things are, not what they are called
pleasant but not lasting a long time
examples: We haven't much time so I'll keep it short and sweet.

idioms.def: nothing at all. People say ‘sweet FA’ to avoid saying ‘fuck all’.

examples: to whisper sweet nothings in somebody’s ear

idioms.def: the pleasant feeling of being successful

meanings.def: a small piece of sweet food, usually made with sugar and/or chocolate and eaten between meals
examples: a packet of sweets
a sweet shop
She booked a hotel suite overlooking Central Park.
Add some honey to make it sweet.
Suck this sweet—it might soothe your throat.

meanings.def: a sweet dish eaten at the end of a meal
examples: I haven't made a sweet today.
Would you like some more sweet?

meanings.def: a way of addressing somebody that you like or love
examples: Don't you worry, my sweet.
